notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: A trap or handler for when the CPU encounters an unknown/bad instruction. This is likely a default interrupt vector.
Purpose: Converts an unsigned integer into a null-terminated ASCII string. This is a common 'itoa' implementation.
column4: param_1: Pointer to a buffer/struct. The resulting string is stored at offset +0x24 from this pointer. param_3: The unsigned integer to convert.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Standard library function to fill a block of memory with a specific byte value. It's optimized for word/half-word writes.
column4: param_1: (void*) destination pointer. param_2: (uint) number of bytes to fill. param_3: (byte) value to fill with.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Standard library function to fill a block of memory with zeros. It's an optimized 'memset(..., 0, ...)' or 'bzero'.
column4: param_1: (void*) destination pointer. param_2: (uint) number of bytes to write.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Standard library function to copy a string with a maximum length, padding with nulls if src is shorter than len.
column4: param_1: (char*) destination. param_2: (char*) source. param_3: (int) max length. Calls lib_bzero (FUN_08000f94) to pad.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sends a 6-byte command packet over a serial bus (likely I2C or SPI) and then delays.
column4: param_1: (uint16_t) A 16-bit value split into two bytes in the packet. Notes: Calls FUN_0800b7a6 (a delay function) for 50ms (0x32).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Initializes the BK4819 RF transceiver by writing 50+ register/value pairs. CONFIRMED from Ghidra analysis.
column4: Notes: Writes to registers 0x00-0x7E. Includes AGC table (reg 0x09 x16), audio filters (0x46-0x4F), squelch (0x28-0x2F).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Reads or writes a 128-byte (0x80) block from/to specific addresses in the main Flash or an external SPI Flash.
column4: param_1: (int) 0 = Read, 1 = Write. Notes: Accesses addresses like 0x8000, 0x9000, 0xb000, 0xf000.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Calculates a simple 8-bit XOR checksum over a block of data.
column4: param_1: (uint) length. param_2: (byte*) data buffer.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Applies a frequency offset to a base frequency. Used for RF channel selection.
column4: Notes: Selects a channel struct based on index at DAT_08008930+0xf4. Reads base freq from offset +0x108, offset from +0x134, and writes result to +0x114.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Loads and parses configuration data for a specific channel (0, 1, or 2) from Flash into its runtime struct.
column4: param_1: (int) channel index [0-2]. param_2: (int) 1 = read from flash. param_3: (int) flash offset. Notes: Populates the struct at DAT_08009428 + (param_1 * 0x58).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Reads a block of data from an SPI peripheral and calculates a CRC-16 checksum on the fly.
column4: param_1: (uint) number of bytes to read. Notes: Uses CRC-16-CCITT-FALSE (poly 0x1021). FUN_0802112c is the byte read function.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Parses an NMEA coordinate string (like $GPRMC) into a data structure.
column4: param_1: (char*) NMEA string. param_2: (struct*) struct to fill. Notes: Identifies N/S (0x4E/0x53) and E/W (0x45/0x57) and converts DDMM.MMMM format.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Scrambles/whitens a 7-byte block of data, likely for GMSK/FSK modulation.
column4: param_1: (byte*) input buffer. param_2: (byte*) output buffer. Notes: Uses a complex bit-shifting and XOR feedback algorithm.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sets or clears enable bits in the DAC control register at 0x40007400. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: bit index (channel/trigger); param_2: 1 enable, 0 disable.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Controls the DAC buffer/trigger configuration bits prior to playback.
column4: param_1: bit index (buffer flag); param_2: 1 set, 0 clear.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Loads a combined waveform/control word into the DAC waveform register block.
column4: param_1: shift amount; param_2: pointer to packed control words.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sets the frequency of the RF synthesizer by writing to a peripheral's registers.
column4: param_1: (uint) Frequency value. param_2: (int) Mode. param_3: (int) Flag. Notes: Writes to registers 0x51, 0x07, 0x08 of an external peripheral.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: A blocking delay function, likely in milliseconds.
column4: param_1: (uint) Number of milliseconds to delay. Notes: Calls a nested spin-wait loop (FUN_0800b7c2).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Microsecond delay function used for SPI timing.
column4: param_1: (uint) Number of microseconds to delay.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Formats and renders the currently selected CTCSS/DCS tone or 'OFF' entry on the LCD.
column4: param_1: column slot (RX/TX/etc.); param_2: tone index (0xFFFF => OFF); param_3: tone category. Calls ToneGraphic_Draw to highlight the active selection.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Draws the tone bargraph/selection cursor and incorporates the tone palette for the current menu context.
column4: param_1: context (0=receive,1=transmit,2=dual); param_2: number of highlighted cells; param_3: palette id; param_4: non-zero to flush LCD.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Arms DMA2 with a new sample buffer targeting DAC1 for tone or AFSK playback. CONFIRMED.
column4: Writes length and buffer pointer into DMA2 registers (base 0x40020430) before re-enabling the channel.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Resets encoder state and clears pending flags.
column4: Called when encoder lock is released or mode changes.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: State machine for the front-panel rotary encoder on PB4/PB5. CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: Debounce counter = 200 ticks. Phase A first = CW (0x14), Phase B first = CCW (0x16). Reads GPIO masks 0x10/0x20.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Reads current phase A and phase B states from GPIO.
column4: Updates internal state buffer at DAT_0800e44c.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Maps APRS modem PTT state onto the GPIO/expander lines (command 0x4001).
column4: param_1: 0=release PTT, 1=assert.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Issues modem command 0x14 and inspects the returned status byte for busy/ready.
column4: Returns 2 when the modem signals ready-to-send and triggers APRS_Modem_ReadStatus.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Fetches status payload from the external APRS/AFSK modem via command 0x42/0x22 and caches it.
column4: Updates status buffer, stores RSSI/flags, and toggles modem lines with APRS_SetPTT.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Primes the modem for transmit, enabling PTT and writing control bytes before sending audio.
column4: Calls APRS_SetPTT(1), queues command frames via FUN_08026fb2, and mirrors status into shared buffers.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Periodically drives PC0-PC3 high and samples PD4-PD7 to decode the 5x4 keypad. CONFIRMED pins.
column4: Uses DAT_800136d8 (GPIOC) for columns, DAT_800136dc (GPIOD) for rows, DAT_800136d0 (PE5) and DAT_800136d4 (PA12) to enable scanning.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Single conversion on ADC2 channel 1 (PA1) returning an 8-bit scaled value used for audio level logic.
column4: Calls FUN_08003108(DAT_80013cd0,1,1,7) then waits on FUN_800030a4 before reading FUN_8000309e.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Single conversion on ADC2 channel 0 (PA0) for battery/AGC sensing.
column4: Same ADC2 sequence as FUN_08013c98 but with channel parameter 0.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Initialises the GPS UART on PC10/PC11 (USART3) for 9600 baud NMEA reception.
column4: Remaps GPIOC pins, programs USART3 registers at 0x40004800 with divisor 0x2580 (9600 baud), enables TX/RX, and powers the port.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Stores column/row window coordinates in the LCD command staging buffer at 0x2000A1D0. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: x1, param_2: x2, param_3: y1, param_4: y2. Writes to offsets 0x00-0x0A of buffer.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Writes a single RGB565 pixel to the current window position. CONFIRMED.
column4: Bounds-checks against 320x240 (0x140 x 0xF0). Frame buffer at 0x20000BD0.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Streams the prepared frame buffer to the LCD over the external bus while holding PC12 as chip select.
column4: Asserts GPIOC12, primes DMA (DAT_0800396c -> 0x40020430), waits for completion, then releases the line.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Controls the TX/RX relay matrix: PE13/PE12/PE14/PE7 select PTT path while PB0/PB1 drive accessory enables.
column4: Parameter 1 chooses routing profile; toggles GPIOE via FUN_08012c3a/FUN_08012c3e and clears PB0/PB1 when idle.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Bit-banged serial readback of the RF relay latch using PE15/PE10/PE11.
column4: Clears PE15 (0x8000) before clocking, pulses PE10 (0x400) and samples PE11 (0x800) via FUN_08012c26.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Reads SPI flash status register and checks WIP (Write In Progress) bit. CONFIRMED.
column4: Returns 0 when flash is ready, non-zero when busy.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Erases a 32KB block using command 0x52. CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: param_1: 24-bit address. Polls status with 500us delays, timeout ~5536 iterations.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Erases a 64KB block using command 0xD8. CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: param_1: 24-bit address. Adds 5ms initial delay before polling.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Erases entire chip using command 0xC7 (199). CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: Adds 100ms initial delay before polling. Can take several seconds.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Erases a 4KB sector using command 0x20. CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: param_1: 24-bit address. Polls status with 2us delays.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Reads data from SPI flash using command 0x03. CONFIRMED from Ghidra.
column4: param_1: 24-bit address. param_2: buffer pointer. param_3: length.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sends a single byte over the SPI flash bus.
column4: param_1: byte to send. Uses software SPI bit-banging.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Programs data to SPI flash using command 0x02.
column4: param_1: 24-bit address. param_2: data pointer. param_3: length (max 256 per page).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sends write enable command (0x06) before erase/program operations. CONFIRMED.
column4: Required before any erase or program command.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Enables USART peripheral by setting TE/RE bits.
column4: param_1: USART base address. param_2: enable flags.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Brings up UART4 on PC10/PC11 at 115200 baud for accessory programming.
column4: Uses FUN_0801272c with the same GPIO masks, writes 0x1C200 to UART4 (0x40004C00), and enables the channel (likely routed through the side connector).

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Configures USART1 (PA9/PA10 at 115200 baud) and routes it to the external Bluetooth module via GPIOA remap.
column4: Enables pins with FUN_0801272c (0x400 mask), loads 0x1C200 into USART1 (0x40013800), and sets TE/RE bits before enabling the peripheral.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Waits for LCD controller to be ready by polling status. CONFIRMED.
column4: Loops up to 100 times with 500us delays.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Builds and sends a 6-byte APRS control packet with command 0x12.
column4: param_1: 16-bit parameter 1. param_2: 16-bit parameter 2.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Fills a rectangular region with a solid color. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: y, param_2: x, param_3: width, param_4: height, param_5: RGB565 color.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Drives the 8080 bus control lines to emit a single command byte to the TFT panel. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: (uint8_t) command value; manipulates GPIOD WR#/CS# via FUN_08012c3a/3e before sending.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Writes one data byte to the TFT panel on the 8080 bus. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: (uint8_t) data value; uses same GPIOD handshake as LCD_WriteCommand but sets D/C high.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Blits a 1-bit-per-pixel bitmap with foreground/background colors. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1-4: position/size, param_5: bitmap data, param_6: bg color, param_7: fg color.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Blits an RGB565 pixel buffer to the display. CONFIRMED.
column4: param_1: y, param_2: x, param_3: width, param_4: height, param_5: pixel buffer pointer.

notes on parameter values/types and inte: Purpose: Sends RAMWR command (0x2C) to begin pixel data transfer. CONFIRMED.
column4: Called before streaming pixel data.
